Here is a precise numerical problem related to Cryptanalysis of Vigenere cipher:

Suppose a Vigenere cipher text is given as "HOPEVHPLF", which is encrypted using the keyword "MATH". What is the original plaintext message?

(Hint: The Vigenere cipher can be broken by first finding the length of the keyword, and then using frequency analysis to determine each letter of the keyword.)
message_2:
To decrypt the Vigenere cipher text "HOPEVHPLF" with the keyword "MATH", we can use the Vigenere decryption formula:

Plaintext = (Ciphertext - Keyword) mod 26

First, we need to convert the letters in the ciphertext and keyword to their corresponding numerical values (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25):

Ciphertext: H(7) O(14) P(15) E(4) V(21) H(7) P(15) L(11) F(5)
Keyword:    M(12) A(0) T(19) H(7) M(12) A(0) T(19) H(7) M(12)

Now, we can apply the decryption formula:

Plaintext: (7-12) (14-0) (15-19) (4-7) (21-12) (7-0) (15-19) (11-7) (5-12)
           (-5) 14 (-4) (-3) 9 7 (-4) 4 (-7)
           (21) 14 (22) (23) 9 7 (22) 4 (19) (mod 26)

Convert the numerical values back to letters:

Plaintext: V O W X J H W E T

So, the original plaintext message is "VOWXJHWET".
